description: From Ancient Greek ἀνταγωνιστής (antagōnistḗs, “opponent”), from ἀνταγωνίζεσθαι (antagōnízesthai, “antagonize”), from ἀγών (agṓn, “contest”) (English agon).

entries.meaning: A strong natural dislike or hatred; antipathy.
examples: Their longstanding antagonism is manifested in frequent scuffles and shouting matches.
